channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING SORTATION. THE CAP CAME OFF THE PLASTIC JUG CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT INTERNALLY AND COAT ALL THE OTHER JUGS IN THE PACKAGE.

  • Description: The plastic Jerrican, had been bumped on the top when a Package Handler was lifting it onto a belt. The bump caused a very small dent and puncture in the top corner. A very small amount of the contents were bubbling from that spot.

item.title: Report X-2024070217
item.description:
Report X-2024070217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: LAUREL
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO SILVER BELT FOR LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE, DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. PACKAGE HAD A CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZER LABEL. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE, PLACED BOX IN SPILL TRAY, AND RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. DAMAGE CONTAINED TO OUTER CARTON. RESPONDER DISCOVERED LOOSE CAP.
